intro: Tecoma austrocaledonica, commonly known as the Kauai trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Tecoma austrocaledonica thrives in full sun and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
